metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12150 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was found that samba before 4.4.16, 4.5.x before 4.5.14, and 4.6.x before 4.6.8 did not enforce "SMB signing" when certain configuration options were enabled. A remote attacker could launch a man-in-the-middle attack and retrieve information in plain-text.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.11

No subscription required
